moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. h4: this is a first, in my career in the Sicilian...
moves.3... Bg7 4. d4 e6 5. Be3 Ne7: no fear for c5: it is just a tempo winning gambit pawn...
moves.6... d5 7. exd5 exd5 8. Bb3 c4 9. Ba4+ B: all forced: Qxd7 is stronger than Nxd7...
moves.11. Nc3 O-O 12. Qd2 a6: we can throw in the Najdorf extension, anywhere we want...
moves.15. Bf4 Nc6: relentless: the last developing piece is coming into play...
moves.17. Kb1: and White resigned on the spot: not sure why; probably, Nf3 is suddenly a big issue...
